subject: Enable mutable config in Congress
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 04:25:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Enable mutable config in Congress

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter. This commit is to use the same.

This allows Congress to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug logging
on and off by changing the config.

tc goal: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html
Change-Id: Ia82715af8a8174e4f0d89ee1d9609487654e4e03
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-04-09 03:57:01.000000000', 'files': ['congress/server/congress_server.py'], 'message': "Enable mutable config in Congress

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter. This commit is to use the same.

This allows Congress to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug logging
on and off by changing the config.

tc goal: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html
Change-Id: Ia82715af8a8174e4f0d89ee1d9609487654e4e03
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Congress

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter. This commit is to use the same.

This allows Congress to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug logging
on and off by changing the config.

tc goal: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html
Change-Id: Ia82715af8a8174e4f0d89ee1d9609487654e4e03

subject: Add a devstack variable for legacy RBAC
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-16 18:43:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Add a devstack variable for legacy RBAC

This patch adds the OCTAVIA_USE_LEGACY_RBAC variable to our devstack plugin.
When set to True it will install the legacy Admin/Owner RBAC policy.json file
for the devstack Octavia install.
This is useful for tempest testing the neutron-lbaas proxy driver that passes
neutron LBaaSv2 API requests through to the Octavia API.

Change-Id: I5f112131b9c57e394349f29fa1b675643784b867
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add a devstack variable for legacy RBAC

This patch adds the OCTAVIA_USE_LEGACY_RBAC variable to our devstack plugin.
When set to True it will install the legacy Admin/Owner RBAC policy.json file
for the devstack Octavia install.
This is useful for tempest testing the neutron-lbaas proxy driver that passes
neutron LBaaSv2 API requests through to the Octavia API.

Change-Id: I5f112131b9c57e394349f29fa1b675643784b867

InternalTLSVncCAFile currently defaults to /etc/ipa/vnc.crt.
Certmonger attempts to save the CA cert to this path as cert_t, however

Moving to /etc/pki/CA/certs which is cert_t resolves the issue, and is

commit_message:
Correct the InternalTLSVncCAFile to comply with selinux policy

InternalTLSVncCAFile currently defaults to /etc/ipa/vnc.crt.
Certmonger attempts to save the CA cert to this path as cert_t, however
/etc/ipa is etc_t.
Moving to /etc/pki/CA/certs which is cert_t resolves the issue, and is
arugably a more suitable location.

Change-Id: Ib275fc43dd772851511598a4932c19fcda706479

subject: Fix creation of resolv.conf on bionic nodes
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-06 14:50:02.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/nodepool-base/finalise.d/89-unbound'], 'message': "Fix creation of resolv.conf on bionic nodes

Currently /etc/resolv.conf is a dangling symlink on bionic:

root@ubuntu-bionic-inap-mtl01-0003371066:~# ls -l /etc/resolv.conf
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 39 Apr  6 01:29 /etc/resolv.conf ->
../run/systemd/resolve/stub-resolv.conf

Thus the

echo 'nameserver 127.0.0.1' > /etc/resolv.conf

in rc.local fails.

Change-Id: I423f5536836e85acabf364c325ebc5d1c44cb2ca
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix creation of resolv.conf on bionic nodes

Currently /etc/resolv.conf is a dangling symlink on bionic:

root@ubuntu-bionic-inap-mtl01-0003371066:~# ls -l /etc/resolv.conf
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 39 Apr  6 01:29 /etc/resolv.conf ->
../run/systemd/resolve/stub-resolv.conf

Thus the

echo 'nameserver 127.0.0.1' > /etc/resolv.conf

in rc.local fails.

Change-Id: I423f5536836e85acabf364c325ebc5d1c44cb2ca

commit_message:
Add redirect for python-openstacksdk project rename

Add a macro to make generating the redirect and tests for a project
rename easy.

Redirect python-openstacksdk to the new name openstacksdk.

Because the .htaccess template generates redirects for all official
projects, this patch won't pass the tests until the governance change
with the rename is approved and merged, so that patch is included as a
depends-on.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555780/
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Change-Id: I97afa686cac31b2ef8beac1df49f98625dee703d

commit_message:
tests: don't rely on configuration files outside tests directory

Following the similar Neutron change. [1]

Recently, the way sibling projects are installed were changed.
It broke networking-midonet gate as neutron-fwaas was installed
under site-packages, where the etc directory is not available.

[1] If1f5ebd981cf06558d5102524211799676068889

Closes-Bug: #1758062
Change-Id: I72aeeac8cbe07f6fc6cb4acf54fb632587d890a0
(cherry picked from commit e1231cd6eabb0992820d0c0fdc629c8a96b5f6b9)

subject: Skip validating the subnetpool if it is none
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 01:32:51.000000000', 'files': ['zun/network/kuryr_network.py'], 'message': 'Skip validating the subnetpool if it is none

In the kuryr driver module, it tries to validate the subnetpool
even if the subnetpool_id is None. This incurrs an extra API
call to Neutron to list the subnetpools.

Change-Id: I0f25eadb68858ec89d00432b03f715c5cb6c0c46
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Skip validating the subnetpool if it is none

In the kuryr driver module, it tries to validate the subnetpool
even if the subnetpool_id is None. This incurrs an extra API
call to Neutron to list the subnetpools.

Change-Id: I0f25eadb68858ec89d00432b03f715c5cb6c0c46

subject: Remove a redundant call of 'save'
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-09 01:26:24.000000000', 'files': ['zun/network/kuryr_network.py'], 'message': "Remove a redundant call of 'save'

In the kuryr module, there is a call on saving the security groups
into the container object on processing the neutron port.
This call is unnecessary because the container object will be
saved again by caller. This patch removes this call.

Change-Id: I68ca6a7c70e1e1b576a3f2d560b480ff6d52e42e
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove a redundant call of 'save'

In the kuryr module, there is a call on saving the security groups
into the container object on processing the neutron port.
This call is unnecessary because the container object will be
saved again by caller. This patch removes this call.

Change-Id: I68ca6a7c70e1e1b576a3f2d560b480ff6d52e42e

Zun server has changed from synchronous deletion to asynchronous
deletion. This mean Zun accepts a request to delete a container
but the container is not deleted right away. In the UI, it is

Change-Id: I05c64a1388356887aba19dc94f27dbbd0d0bcc02

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Present container deletion better

Zun server has changed from synchronous deletion to asynchronous
deletion. This mean Zun accepts a request to delete a container
but the container is not deleted right away. In the UI, it is
better to present the container in 'deleting' state instead of
removing the container from displaying.

Change-Id: I05c64a1388356887aba19dc94f27dbbd0d0bcc02
(cherry picked from commit 6f4827bea65134f152a85980bbe0a0accc0c26ce)

admin cannot operate ordinary tenant's container

commit_message:
Check disk quota support on filter scheduler

The compute manager will provide information about if the node
support disk quota. The DiskFilter will schedule container
based on the disk quota support. If the container request
non-zero amount of disk, the filter scheduler will place the
container to the node that supports disk quota.

Change-Id: I8c4df909775fe120156bb058adf17381205d5a39

commit_message:
Add disk_quota_supported to compute_node

Add 'disk_quota_supported' field to the data model of compute node.
This field will be leveraged by the scheduler to do filtering based
on disk quota supported of each node.

Change-Id: I8c449c2a44bd6afbc79c4accb083d9f1bf51085a

commit_message:
Print a warning if disk quota is not unsupported

If the CONF.default_disk is configured to be non-zero but the node
doesn't support disk quota. Zun will ignore the configured
default because it is impossible to be realized. A warning message
will be printed to the log as a record.

Change-Id: Ie322984d5f3212e139470b80076c781b5996a9b1

commit_message:
Cleanup and rename test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot

I'm trying to debug a failure in a nova change
in test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot but
need more debug information, specifically the
volume details when it fails. While doing this,
I'm going to cleanup the comments and variable
names so this test can actually be understanble.

Also, this renames the test itself since the 'ebs'
part (AWS Elastic Block Storage) has long been a
source of confusion.

Change-Id: I4d60adc95d72be609927e36a28fd7c86b5ee86bc
Related-Bug: #1747693

commit_message:
Install mon servers in parallel.

The ceph-ansible roles handle restarting services in serial via a
script, so we shouldn't need to run this in serial.

Change-Id: Ia2f2694abe02af282e7a98fcc40410b0510cc1cd
Closes-Bug: #1741085

commit_message:
Make memcache limit_maxbytes configurable

The "limit_maxbytes" default value is 64M. It is not a proper setting
for large cluster. We should make it configurable to fit with more
deployment cases.

Change-Id: I9a85b1b3ade7498495f510897292ae1ed9d73bfa
Closes-Bug: #1758286

commit_message:
Fix revert method for batch member update

The create/delete reverts worked because the old/new member lists were
simply db object lists, but the update list is tuples of (obj, dict) and
need a little bit of massaging.

Change-Id: I423f9a679c161b11cf51337717e4e7e73d71a1b3
